meanings.definition: To discourage or prevent someone from doing something
meanings.sent1: The loud alarm was deterring the thief from breaking into the house.
meanings.sent2: The police presence in the area is deterring criminals from committing crimes.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog was deterring the mailman, making him rethink his delivery strategy.
meanings.sent4: Her determined attitude was deterring any doubts from creeping into her mind.
meanings.sent5: The bright warning signs were deterring drivers from speeding on the dangerous curve.

meanings.definition: Serving to prevent or discourage something
meanings.sent1: The security cameras are a deterring factor for potential intruders.
meanings.sent2: The deterring effect of the warning label on the medicine bottle is clear.
meanings.sent3: The deterring smell of the repellent kept the pesky mosquitoes away.
meanings.sent4: The deterring presence of the guard dog made the trespassers think twice.
meanings.sent5: The deterring sound of the alarm system alerted everyone to the danger.
